name: Hardest "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (1987) Part 2 Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 6: Donatello built a training dummy out of an old household appliance. What was the base of the machine?
questions.explanation:
washing machine.

	Donatello continued to tinker in this episode, building the training dummy for Mikey and Ralph to use. The dummy was easy to fight until it slipped into spin mode and bested Mikey in battle. The episode was called "The Case of the Killer Pizzas".

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 7: Scientist Baxter Stockman failed his mission once again so Krang decided to get rid of him. Instead of incinerating him, though, the machine backfired and did what?
questions.correct: Mutated him into a human fly hybrid.
options: Turned him into a giant brain.
Shrunk him down to the size of an ant
Gave him the power to control and manipulate metal objects.
questions.explanation:
Mutated him into a human fly hybrid.

	The episode was called "Enter: The Fly". Stockman had previously in the series invented the robotic Mousers that were used to hunt down Master Splinter. Since that time, in the series' third episode, he was working for Shredder and Krang. In this episode Krang was fed up with the constant failures and tried to kill him. Instead he mutated into a giant fly and escaped Krang's lair.

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 8: In this episode the turtles meet four mutant frogs from another part of the country. What state were the frogs from when Shredder recruited them?
questions.explanation:
Florida.

	The Punk Frogs as they were known, were from a Florida swamp. They were created when Krang accidentally dumped a canister of ooze in a Florida swamp rather than sending it to Shredder in New York. An ion storm caused the canister to go to the wrong place. Shredder went down to Florida and convinced the frogs that he was the good guy and the Turtles the evil doers. They fought on his side until finding out differently.  The episode was called "Invasion of the Punk Frogs".

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 9: Master Splinter returned to his human form in this episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	While he did return to human form, the formula that Donatello created ended up not being permanent and by the end of the episode he had returned to his former Rat-like form. In the short term he did get to walk the streets as a human again for a short while.  The episode was called "Splinter No More".

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 10: The city of New York unveiled a new robot cop in this episode. What was name the robot officer was known by?
questions.explanation:
Rex.

	The episode was called "New York's Shiniest".  Rex-1 was the official designation of the officer, but he was known as simply Rex after his formal introduction. During the episode, Rex malfunctioned and turned evil, forcing the Turtles to take action to stop him.

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 11: Three out of this world teenagers returned to New York (they had visited in season 1) in this episode. Where were they from?
questions.explanation:
Dimension X.

	The episode was called "Teenagers from Dimension X". The trio consisted of three teenagers, two male and one female, from the dimension where everyone is always at war. The three only wanted to have fun and were constantly running from the law because they refused to join an army.

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 12: April was temporarily transformed, or mutated, into what animal?
questions.explanation:
cat.

	The episode was called "The Catwoman from Channel Six". April was involved in an accident with a transporter that caused her to meld her DNA with that of a stray cat that had wandered into the room she was in.

questions.text: Season 2, Episode 13: What major landmark was the primary setting for this episode?
questions.explanation:
Niagara Falls.

	This was the second season finale of the show, called "Return of the Technodrome". Krang and Shredder were attempting to use the power generated by the hydroelectric plant at the falls to return the Technodrome from Dimension X to New York. The plan caused a power outage across the entire city of New York.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 1: Which member of the Turtle clan was injured in a fight with Shredder?
questions.explanation:
Splinter.

	The episode was titled "Beneath These Streets". It was starting this season that the show became a five-day-a-week production, instead of just on Saturdays. Due to that the episode count for the season was 47 - more than the first two seasons combined. In the episode the Turtles got complacent when they thought they'd beaten Shredder and Krang for good. That complacency led to Splinter's injury.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 2: What weapon did Shredder use against the city?
questions.explanation:
A gravity altering device.

	The episode was called "Sky Turtles". Shredder used the device to make it easy to control everything in the city. Only his goons had boots that allowed them to walk.
